div.head: 湯火燒灼
div.div: burns by boiling water and fire

bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

entry.def: burns by boiling water and fire

sense.def: Pathological Condition identical with tang huo shang 湯火傷 , harm caused by boiling water and fire. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry bai ye 柏葉 quoting Ben cao tu jing 本草圖經 : 其方采葉入臼中，濕搗，令極爛 如泥，冷水調作膏，以治大人及小兒湯湯火燒，塗傅於傷處，用帛子系 定，三二日瘡當斂，仍滅瘢 , “The recipe: pluck its leaves and pound them wet in a mortar until they are extremely sodden, like mud. Add cold water to prepare a paste. This serves to cure adults and children alike who have been scalded by boiling water or burnt by fire. It is to be applied on the damaged location, and fixated with a textile bandage. After two or three days, the sores will be closed, and the scars will vanish”, writes: 湯火燒灼：柏葉生搗塗之，系定二 三日，止痛滅瘢 , “For burns by boiling water and fire : Fresh bai leaves are to be pounded and applied externally. [The paste] is to be bandaged and fixated for two to three days. This will end the pain and make the scars vanish”.
